article.title: Plasma Wake Accelerators: Introduction and Historical Overview

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the general trend observed in the evolution of accelerators over time?
choices: Accelerators have become significantly larger.
Accelerators have become much less efficient.
Accelerators have transitioned from exploring the atom to exploring the nucleus.
Accelerators have become primarily used for societal applications.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which societal application has the largest annual market for industrial accelerators?
choices: Cancer Therapy
Ion Implantation
Electron cutting and welding
Non-destructive testing

multiple_choice_question.text: What key advantage of plasma \'cavities\' does Figure 3 illustrate?
choices: Plasma cavities can sustain higher electric fields than radiofrequency cavities.
Plasma cavities allow for more precise control of the electron beam.
Plasma cavities are significantly more complex to construct.
Plasma cavities eliminate the need for external electron injection.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula ωpe = √(nee²/meε0) represent?
choices: The critical density of a plasma.
The electron plasma frequency.
The speed of light in a vacuum.
The dephasing length of an electron in a plasma wave.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the phase difference between the electron density perturbation and the electric field in a linear plasma wave?
choices: 0 degrees
45 degrees
90 degrees
180 degrees
